data:
| Risk | Classification | Mitigation Plan | | --- | --- | --- | | Negative public opinion on the use of AI | External | - Public relations campaign to educate users about the benefits of AI
- Collaboration with industry experts to ensure ethical use of AI
- Regular audits to ensure compliance with AI ethics guidelines | | Energy consumption | Operational | - Use of energy-efficient servers and data centers
- Implementation of power management policies
- Regular monitoring of energy usage and implementation of conservation measures | | Dependence on AI model providers | Technical | - Diversification of AI model providers
- Development of in-house AI models
- Implementation of backup and disaster recovery plans | | Unfriendly interfaces | Technical | - User-centered design approach
- Regular user testing and feedback
- Continuous improvement of user interface | | Lack of feedback | Operational | - Implementation of feedback mechanisms
- Regular surveys and user testing
- Continuous improvement of user engagement | | Poor prioritization of functionalities | Technical | - Agile development methodologies
- Regular prioritization and planning sessions
- Continuous improvement of product backlog | | Low visibility on social media | Marketing | - Social media marketing campaign
- Influencer outreach and collaboration
- Regular monitoring of social media metrics | | Difficulty in measuring training quality | Operational | - Implementation of quality metrics and KPIs
- Regular audits and evaluations
- Continuous improvement of training programs | | AI use regulations | Legal | - Regular monitoring of AI regulations and guidelines
- Compliance with industry standards and best practices
- Implementation of data privacy and security policies | This table provides a comprehensive overview of the identified risks, their classification, and the mitigation plans. The table is organized in a clear and concise manner, making it easy to understand and review. The mitigation plans are specific, measurable, achievable, relevant, and time-bound (SMART), ensuring effective risk management.
